verses.kjv: We then, as workers together with him, beseech you also that ye receive not the grace of God in vain.
verses.ct: As God's coworkers, we urge you not to let the grace of God that you've received go to waste.

verses.kjv: (For he saith, I have heard thee in a time accepted, and in the day of salvation have I succoured thee: behold, now is the accepted time; behold, now is the day of salvation.)
verses.ct: (For God says, "At just the right time, I heard you, and on the day of salvation, I helped you." Look — right now is the right time! Right now is the day of salvation.)

verses.kjv: Giving no offence in any thing, that the ministry be not blamed:
verses.ct: We don't put obstacles in anyone's path, so that no one can find fault with our ministry.

verses.kjv: But in all things approving ourselves as the ministers of God, in much patience, in afflictions, in necessities, in distresses,
verses.ct: Instead, in everything we do, we demonstrate that we are servants of God — through great endurance, through hardships, through desperate situations, through intense pressure,

verses.kjv: In stripes, in imprisonments, in tumults, in labours, in watchings, in fastings;
verses.ct: through beatings, through time in prison, through riots, through exhausting work, through sleepless nights, through going without food,

verses.kjv: By pureness, by knowledge, by longsuffering, by kindness, by the Holy Ghost, by love unfeigned,
verses.ct: through moral purity, through understanding, through patience, through kindness, through the Holy Spirit, through genuine love,

verses.kjv: By the word of truth, by the power of God, by the armour of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,
verses.ct: through truthful speech, through the power of God, through the weapons of righteousness in both hands,

verses.kjv: By honour and dishonour, by evil report and good report: as deceivers, and yet true;
verses.ct: through honor and disgrace, through slander and praise. People call us frauds, yet we speak the truth.

verses.kjv: As unknown, and yet well known; as dying, and, behold, we live; as chastened, and not killed;
verses.ct: They treat us as nobodies, yet we are well known. We seem to be dying, yet look — we keep on living. We are disciplined by God, yet not destroyed.

verses.kjv: As sorrowful, yet alway rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and yet possessing all things.
verses.ct: We carry sorrow, yet we are always full of joy. We are poor, yet we make many people rich. We have nothing, yet we possess everything.

verses.kjv: O ye Corinthians, our mouth is open unto you, our heart is enlarged.
verses.ct: Corinthians, we have spoken openly to you, and our hearts are wide open toward you.

verses.kjv: Ye are not straitened in us, but ye are straitened in your own bowels.
verses.ct: We haven't held back our affection from you — it's you who have held back your affection from us.

verses.kjv: Now for a recompence in the same, (I speak as unto my children,) be ye also enlarged.
verses.ct: So as a fair response — I'm talking to you as a father talks to his children — open your hearts wide to us too.

verses.kjv: Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship hath righteousness with unrighteousness? and what communion hath light with darkness?
verses.ct: Don't team up with unbelievers in an unequal partnership. What do righteousness and wickedness have in common? What does light share with darkness?

verses.kjv: And what concord hath Christ with Belial? or what part hath he that believeth with an infidel?
verses.ct: What harmony exists between Christ and Belial? What does a believer have in common with an unbeliever?

verses.kjv: And what agreement hath the temple of God with idols? for ye are the temple of the living God; as God hath said, I will dwell in them, and walk in them; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.
verses.ct: What agreement can the temple of God have with idols? Because we are the temple of the living God! As God has said, "I will live among them and walk among them. I will be their God, and they will be my people."

verses.kjv: Wherefore come out from among them, and be ye separate, saith the Lord, and touch not the unclean thing; and I will receive you,
verses.ct: Therefore, "Come out from among them and separate yourselves," says the Lord. "Don't touch what is unclean, and I will welcome you."

verses.kjv: And will be a Father unto you, and ye shall be my sons and daughters, saith the Lord Almighty.
verses.ct: "I will be a Father to you, and you will be my sons and daughters," says the Lord Almighty.
